notes.text: An update is now available for Red Hat OpenShift Application Runtimes.
notes.title: Topic

notes.text:
Red Hat support for Spring Boot provides an application platform that reduces the complexity of developing and operating applications (monoliths and microservices) for OpenShift as a containerized platform.

This release of Red Hat support for Spring Boot 2.7.2 serves as a replacement for Red Hat support for Spring Boot 2.5.12, and includes security, bug fixes and enhancements. For more information, see the release notes listed in the References section.

Security Fix(es):

* reactor-netty: specific redirect configuration allows for a credentials leak (CVE-2020-5404)

* kubernetes-client: Insecure deserialization in unmarshalYaml method (CVE-2021-4178)

* protobuf-java: potential DoS in the parsing procedure for binary data (CVE-2021-22569)

* undertow: potential security issue in flow control over HTTP/2 may lead to DOS(incomplete fix for CVE-2021-3629) (CVE-2022-1259)

* undertow: Double AJP response for 400 from EAP 7 results in CPING failures (CVE-2022-1319)

* spring-expression: Denial of service via specially crafted SpEL expression (CVE-2022-22950)

For more details about the security issue(s), including the impact, a CVSS score, acknowledgments, and other related information, refer to the CVE page(s) listed in the References section.
notes.title: Details

publisher.issuing_authority: Red Hat Product Security is responsible for vulnerability handling across all Red Hat offerings.
publisher.name: Red Hat Product Security

document.title: Red Hat Security Advisory: Red Hat support for Spring Boot 2.7.2 update

notes.text: The HttpClient from Reactor Netty, versions 0.9.x prior to 0.9.5, and versions 0.8.x prior to 0.8.16, may be used incorrectly, leading to a credentials leak during a redirect to a different domain. In order for this to happen, the HttpClient must have been explicitly configured to follow redirects.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: reactor-netty: specific redirect configuration allows for a credentials leak
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
Before applying the update, back up your existing installation, including all applications, configuration files, databases and database settings, and so on.

The References section of this erratum contains a download link for the update. You must be logged in to download the update.

vulnerabilities.title: reactor-netty: specific redirect configuration allows for a credentials leak

notes.text: A arbitrary code execution flaw was found in the Fabric 8 Kubernetes client affecting versions 5.0.0-beta-1 and above. Due to an improperly configured YAML parsing, this will allow a local and privileged attacker to supply malicious YAML.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: kubernetes-client: Insecure deserialization in unmarshalYaml method
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: Red Hat CodeReady Studio 12 is not affected by this flaw because it does not ship a vulnerable version of kubernetes-client; the version that it ships does not use SnakeYAML.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.

notes.text: A flaw was found in protobuf-java. Google Protocol Buffer (protobuf-java) allows the interleaving of com.google.protobuf.UnknownFieldSet fields. By persuading a victim to open specially-crafted content, a remote attacker could cause a timeout in the ProtobufFuzzer function, resulting in a denial of service.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: protobuf-java: potential DoS in the parsing procedure for binary data

notes.text: A flaw was found in Undertow. A potential security issue in flow control handling by the browser over HTTP/2 may cause overhead or a denial of service in the server.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: undertow: potential security issue in flow control over HTTP/2 may lead to DOS(incomplete fix for CVE-2021-3629)

notes.text: This flaw occurs because of an incomplete fix for CVE-2021-3629.

vulnerabilities.title: undertow: potential security issue in flow control over HTTP/2 may lead to DOS(incomplete fix for CVE-2021-3629)

notes.text: A flaw was found in Undertow. For an AJP 400 response, EAP 7 is improperly sending two response packets, and those packets have the reuse flag set even though JBoss EAP closes the connection. A failure occurs when the connection is reused after a 400 by CPING since it reads in the second SEND_HEADERS response packet instead of a CPONG.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: undertow: Double AJP response for 400 from EAP 7 results in CPING failures

notes.text: A flaw was found in the Spring Framework. This flaw allows an attacker to craft a special Spring Expression, causing a denial of service.
